title: BBC Local Live: Northamptonshire - BBC News
summary: county council staff wo n't get pay rise because it would cost £ 1m .
exhibition aims to bring abuse which 'happens behind closed doors ' into the open .

documents.title: weather : frost expected after rain clears
text: rain clearing eastwards this evening will bring lengthy clear spells and temperatures low enough for a frost in places in parts of the eastern region as the temperature drops to a minimum of -1c ( 30f ) .
patchy cloud will bring isolated showers across northern counties later in the night .
saturday outlook : a chilly start with frost in places .
some dry and bright weather but also frequent showers across northern and eastern counties .
feeling cold in a brisk northerly breeze .
more details on bbc weather :
author: Alex Dolan
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: that 's all from us
text: our live updates have now finished for the week - thanks for your company .
do n't forget northampton town and brackley town are in the fa cup first round tomorrow .
and tonight northampton actor matt smith ( second right ) is on the graham norton show on bbc one .
see you for more live news , sport , weather and travel for northamptonshire on monday from 08:00 .

documents.title: fa cup first round : brackley hoping for repeat of 2013 giant-killing
text: meanwhile , brackley town travel to league one gillingham away in the fa cup tomorrow .
the tie will bring back happy memories for the national league north side , who beat the gills 1-0 at st james park in a first round replay in 2013 after drawing at gillingham 1-1 .
brackley will be hoping for more of this
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: fa cup first round : cobblers face non-league opposition at sixfields
text: northampton town welcome isthmian league premier division side harrow borough tomorrow in the first round of the fa cup .

northampton will be confident , especially at home , but last year in the second round the cobblers faced non-league northwich victoria ( below ) and needed a last-minute winner , after going 2-0 down , to progress .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: grade ii-listed pub shut for 15 months could become home
text: northamptonshire could be losing another pub .
the grade ii-listed woolpack in weldon was a pub for centuries , but has been shut since august 2015 .
plans to turn it into a home will be considered by corby councillors next week .
a council report says the village still has two other pubs and the cricket club , and evidence suggests the woolpack is no longer viable .
however , some locals still hope it can reopen .
author: Martin Borley
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: ex-eastenders star promises 'fun time ' at kettering christmas lights switch-on , with or without lohan
text: cheryl fergison , who played heather trott in eastenders , has confirmed that she will be turning on kettering 's christmas lights , but kettering borough council is still hopeful it can get hollywood star lindsay lohan along too .
fergison is starring in kettering lighthouse 's panto this year , and the plan was always for one of the panto stars to turn on the lights .

but after the town 's mp philip hollobone invited lindsay lohan to the light switch-on at the end of the month following her eu referendum night tweet about the town , it was hoped the mean girls star would join them .

a council spokesman told the northamptonshire telegraph : `` kettering council has been in direct contact with ms lohan 's representatives ; her schedule is very tight but they are looking to see if they can make it work . ''
ok so i may not be your 1st choice to turn on the lights but i can guarantee a fun time all round with lots of interaction with the crowd
having worked with and snapped cheryl in the past i can confirm she is a lovely person and kettering will love her .
you 'll give 100 % whereas l logan probably would n't even bother showing up !
ignore the petty idiots who prefer the likes of her over you !

documents.title: northampton author alan moore on capitalism
text: alan moore , the graphic novelist behind works including watchmen , v for vendetta and from hell , has published his magnum opus jerusalem - 614,000 words of part-northampton chronicles , part-autobiography .
the anti-establishment writer tells the world tonight 's nicola stanbridge he believes he 's now pinpointed the original site of capitalism which inspires his novel .
author: The World Tonight

documents.title: northampton chronicle & echo : fireworks guide
text: fancy heading out to some fireworks tonight ?
the northampton chronicle & echo has a guide to all the major displays across the whole of northamptonshire .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: schoolchildren quiz cobblers plays on their first pair of football boots
text: youngsters from duston school have interviewed northampton town defenders rod mcdonald and zander diamond as part of bbc news school report - my team .
author: BBC School Report

documents.title: weather : mostly dry and cold
text: some persistent rain is likely this afternoon in southern parts such as brackley , but northern parts will probably stay dry and bright but rather cool , with a high of 9c ( 48f ) .
there are more details on the bbc weather website .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: council 'poor financial management ' cost staff pay rise , says union
text: kev standishday of workers ' union unison said the 61 % of northamptonshire county council staff rated `` highly effective or exceptional '' by their managers would be `` something to celebrate '' .
the authority said this figure was higher than the 25 % of staff it had budgeted to give this performance-related pay to , so it would not be able to give it to anyone .

mr standishday said `` hard-working staff '' were denied the rise because of the council 's `` poor management '' of finances , and pointed out a recent audit from the company kpmg said the authority did not offer `` value for money '' last year .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: pay rise costing £ 1m would have meant redundancies , says council chief executive
text: northamptonshire county council said had it paid the £ 1m-worth of pay `` increments '' to staff which were rated `` highly effective or exceptional '' , it would have had to have made 5 % of staff redundant .
in an email to staff , council chief executive paul blantern said it would now be `` conducting a wholesale review of the pay and reward system '' .
he also said the figure of 61 % of staff being rated by their managers so highly was `` too high when you compare it to the performance of the council as a whole '' .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: county council staff wo n't get pay rise because it would cost £ 1m
text: pay rises worth about £ 1m owed to staff at northamptonshire county council wo n't be paid .
the `` increments '' go to the best performing staff - but many more employees than expected were ranked in the top performance categories .
every other year staff at the county council who are rated in the highest categories in their appraisal get a pay rise .
the authority thought 25 % of staff would reach these targets , costing almost half a million pounds .
but in fact more than 60 % reached the target and the pay rises would have cost £ 1m - so no-one will now get one .
in an email to staff this week , the council 's chief executive said he knew staff would be disappointed but pay needed to be financially viable .
he said managers needed to take responsibility and too many staff were being rated highly when you compare that to the performance of the authority as a whole .
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton politics reporter

documents.title: 'failures ' over child abuse 'should never be allowed to continue '
text: northamptonshire 's police and crime commissioner says he 's determined to make tackling child abuse a top priority .
steven mold was at the opening of the wall of silence exhibition in northampton , that looks at the stories of children who 've been victims of abuse .
[ the exhibition ] is a litany of failure of public institutions , that should never ever be allowed to continue .
we 've got to do something about it . ''
author: Willy Gilder
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: exhibition aims to bring abuse which 'happens behind closed doors ' into the open
text: it 's hoped teenagers in the county may be able to talk more freely about problems in their relationships as a result of taking part in a project on child abuse .
the wall of silence exhibition , which features contributions from those who have suffered abuse as a child , will be at the university of northampton for the next month .

laura knight , director of the institute of public safety crime and justice based at the university , said it was `` very difficult to talk about the abuse in intimate relationships '' and the project aims to help people talk about `` what happens behind closed doors '' .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: winners of food and drink awards receive accolades
text: northamptonshire 's food and drink awards were presented last night .
the restaurant of the year was the palmichel in burton latimer , while the top chef accolade went to shane clark from 185 watling street in towcester .
the plough in shutlanger was named food pub of the year and elsie 's pay-as-you-feel cafe in northampton was the local food hero .
you can find all the winners , runners-up and finalist on the food and drink awards facebook page .
author: Andrew Radd
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: new west coast rail franchise to run hs2 services
text: a new rail franchise combining the current intercity west coast mainline with hs2 high-speed services has been announced by the government .
the new franchise will be called the west coast partnership and is scheduled to start on 1 april 2019 .
the operator will be responsible for services on both the west coast mainline from 2019 and running the initial hs2 services in 2026 .
construction of the hs2 track is scheduled to begin next year .
author: BBC Business News

documents.title: matt smith 'went down ravine ' while riding runaway horse during the crown filming
text: matt smith has revealed was `` so scared '' as he lost control of his horse during filming for lavish netflix drama the crown .
the doctor who actor , from northampton , plays the duke of edinburgh in the costume drama .
he said he was riding a horse when it galloped off during filming in south africa .
smith told the graham norton show : `` these horses were being a bit frisky .
we were meant to get on them and trot off and have this lovely love scene , which did n't even make the cut .
`` in my stupidity i got on the horse and cantered around and then it just went .
i tried to grab a branch and everyone was shouting 'oh my god , do n't grab the branch ! '
so i went under the branch and then down a ravine .
`` i was so scared .
as it galloped towards a herd of zebra , a huge man grabbed it by the reins and saved my life . ''
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: brawn : 'anyone who thinks they 're friends with bernie - watch out '
text: former mercedes f1 boss ross brawn has been discussing the difficulty of dealing with the sport 's ringleader bernie ecclestone .
brawn and ecclestone both clashed when the former was boss of his own eponymous team and at mercedes - both based in brackley .
brawn said : `` anyone who thinks they 're bernie 's best friend had best watch out because bernie does not have best friends , his focus is the business .
`` the relationships are vital in any business .
but i understand bernie and i did n't make enough effort during that period to perhaps give him the respect that was due .
he has achieved an enormous amount in f1 . ''
meanwhile , brawn says he would be happy to work alongside ecclestone if he was offered a job running the sport .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: northampton saints captain tom wood reflects on being called 'distinctly average '
text: tom wood , the captain of northampton saints , told me about being labelled `` distinctly average '' and being dropped by eddie jones after england 's rugby world cup failure in 2015 .
wood has been out of the england squad for a year , but has returned after a run of high profile injuries to other players .
i also asked about his new look and he said he has grown his hair as a result of laziness .
author: Chris Jones
BBC rugby reporter

documents.title: weather : mainly dry with sunshine , but some showers are possible
text: a mostly dry and bright day with sunny spells and light winds .
scattered showers will affect some areas , especially during the afternoon .
it will feel chilly once again with a high of 9c ( 48f ) .
here 's my full forecast
there are more details on the bbc weather website .
author: Elizabeth Rizzini
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: welcome back to live updates
text: good morning .
it 's friday !
we 'll be bringing you all the news , weather , sport and travel for northamptonshire .
we 'll soon tell you the winners of the northamptonshire food & drink awards , and build up to the cobblers and brackley games in the fa cup first round .
if you want to get in touch then please email us or head to twitter .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: that 's all from us today
text: updates for bbc northamptonshire live have now finished - we 'll be back tomorrow from 08:00 .
have a good evening .

documents.title: weather : milder tonight with a chance of rain tomorrow
text: it will be a cold and rather cloudy end to the day , with the risk of showery rain later this evening and overnight .
a milder night than last night , with more cloud cover and a low temperature of 6c ( 43f ) .
it will be a rather cloudy start to tomorrow , with the chance of a few spots of showery rain .
becoming brighter but turning cloudier in the east later , with highs of 11c ( 52f ) .
there are more details on the bbc weather website .
author: Alex Dolan
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: the apprentice : will karthik nagesan make it through ?
text: the apprentice returns tonight and the candidates have to launch a new cycling product and get the public to invest through crowdfunding .
amongst those hoping to survive lord sugar 's firing finger is kettering it consultant karthik nagesan , who is already making quite an impression .
but will he succeed tonight ?
find out at 21:00 on bbc one .
author: BBC One

documents.title: local paper round-up : graffiti on britain 's best high street , skylight fall , frozen marathon
text: elsewhere in northamptonshire :
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: on this day : cobblers footballer loses life at sea in world war one
text: on this day in 1915 , northampton town 's harry springthorpe was lost at sea when a u-boat torpedoed the ss mercian .
he was a bank clerk and england amateur international .
he is remembered on the helles memorial on the tip of the gallipoli peninsula .
author: Graham McKechnie
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: daventry christmas tradition under threat
text: i 'm sorry but we are going to have mention the c-word christmas !
an appeal has been made in daventry to save a popular long-standing christmas tradition .
every year danetre rotary club arranges for santa to tour the area on a giant sleigh , while volunteers collect money for charity .
but this year the warehouse where the sleigh and the tractors which pull it are usually stored is n't available .
unless a new storage facility can be found , organisers say santa 's tour is unlikely to happen .
author: Martin Heath
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: the giant bolster retires 'a hero ' , says co-owner
text: simon hunt , the northampton businessman who co-owns 2012 cheltenhem gold cup runner-up the giant bolster , has spoken about the horse 's retirement on twitter .
the giant bolster has been retired , he 's fit & well but the time is right .
he 's been a hero for us taking us to places we could only dream of
well deserved , hunty
cheers steve
what a legend ? !
best go buy another one half as good shunty .
i 'll be bored af all winter now .
thanks , i 'm trying hard i want to keep you busy !
happy retirement to him
cheers
one of my faves , thanks for retiring him safely .
great
thank you clare
he 's the epitome of jumps racing .
will never forget being at trials day '12 when he made all under scu a privilege to see .
what a day that was , thank you
love this horse happy retirement xx
thank you
sorry to hear that simon , but absolutely delighted that he 's been retired fit & well as befits the horse of a lifetime .
cheers dave
he certainly has been !
i remember him on countryfile 3 days before the supreme .
ran his heart out then and every time since
he certainly did , thank you
has been a real trooper happy retirement gb
cheers darren thanks for your support
will definitely miss him on the track .
what a horse he was .
happy retirement champ .
thanks aaron

documents.title: northampton-owned race horse retires after two gold cup places
text: the giant bolster , which placed in the 2012 and 2014 cheltenham gold cup , has been retired .
the horse , co-owned by northampton businessman simon hunt , ran at seven consecutive cheltenham festivals .
the giant bolster was a 50-1 runner-up to synchronised in the 2012 gold cup ( and was beaten by three-quarters of a length when third to lord windermere two years later .
the 11-year-old bows out having won just under £ 373,000 in prize-money in a 40-race career .
author: Laura Cook
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: county council wants farthinghoe bypass , but has no funding in place
text: northamptonshire county council says it 's keen to build a bypass around the village of farthinghoe , in the south of the county .
but it has n't yet identified how it could be funded , nor when it could actually be built .
farthinghoe is now the only village on the route between the m40 and milton keynes , the a422 , without a bypass .
a consultation with local people has identified a route to the north of the village , and the county council cabinet says it wants to add building a bypass to its priority list .
but any construction will depend on identifying funding .
it 'll be discussed by the council 's cabinet next week .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: food and drink awards celebrate county 's produce
text: tonight is the northamptonshire food & drink awards .
local bakers , chefs and wine makers will be battling out to be named the county 's finest producers .
one finalist is grant wentzel , from the rose & crown in yardley hastings , who is up for the chef of the year award .

documents.title: weather : cold and rather cloudy
text: it will stay rather cold but dry this afternoon , with more cloud than this morning and a high temperature of 9c ( 48f ) .
there are more details on the bbc weather website .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: mum 's 'enforced ' split from son slammed
text: mum 's 'enforced ' split from son slammed

documents.title: on this day : vicar remembers his popstar past
text: rev richard coles , broadcaster and vicar of finedon , has posted this throwback to his past as a member of the communards .
he posted this from 30 years ago , when the band played the olympia music hall in paris
30 years ago today , folks !
- total music content on my ipad .
# eclectic # limited
# comprehensive
what would that man said about the man you are now ?
same man , different man ?
i 'm not sure i would have quite got it back then .
are you still in touch with mr somerville , or are you marr to his morrissey , liam to his noel , etc ?
still in touch and on the most cordial of terms .
that 's what i wanted to hear
still friends ?
oh yes .
that 's excellent .

documents.title: your november frost
text: it is getting colder , and our bbc weather watchers are capturing the frost
you can send us your or become a bbc weather watcher .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: rugby : saints wing north in wales side to face australia
text: northampton saints wing george north has been announced in the wales team to face australia on saturday in cardiff .
it comes after premiership clubs agreed to a `` one-off '' change of policy to allow north , and harlequins ' jamie roberts , to play in the game which falls outside world rugby 's test window .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: new wellingborough prison : 'the prize campaigners have been chasing '
text: today 's announcement about a new prison for wellingborough is what many people in the town have been waiting for .
ever since the old prison closed in 2012 , campaigners and the local mp peter bone have been relentless in calling for this move , to help deal with a shortage of places .
the government says it will build five new jails by 2020 , but wellingborough is the only one of two sites to be named so far .
that must be seen as a victory for local campaigners .
the prisons minister sam gyimah is promising the move will bring 3,000 jobs to the area and an £ 80m a year boost to the economy - that is the prize those campaigners have been chasing .
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton politics reporter

documents.title: mother says social workers 'did n't consider ' her son when they separated them
text: the mother who was separated from her adopted son for almost five years has said that social workers from northamptonshire county council `` have n't done anything positive '' for her family , and that she `` does n't have a good word to say about them '' .
the county council has been told by the local government ombudsman to apologise to the family and pay compensation for the `` distress , and frustration '' it 's caused .
the mother of the boy said the social workers involved in the case `` did n't consider the child , did n't consider the whole family , their priority was themselves '' .
the child , who has significant developmental issues and impaired speech , now lives at home .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: wellingborough prison : a timeline
text: wellingborough prison : a timeline

documents.title: 'enforced separation ' stops mother seeing son for years
text: a mother was separated from her adopted son for almost five years after a social worker gave her an ultimatum over his care , a report has found .
the woman , who adopted the disabled boy at a young age , had appealed unsuccessfully for nearby respite support .
instead he was placed with a foster family more than two hours away .
the local government ombudsman dr jane martin said the mother felt unable to challenge an `` enforced separation '' , and the council had threatened to remove the boy completely from her if she did .
northamptonshire county council has apologised to the family and promised a review of its procedures .
author: Orla Moore
BBC News

documents.title: 'relentless campaigner ' peter bone 'delighted ' wellingborough is to get a new prison
text: the mp for wellingborough , peter bone , says he is `` absolutely delighted '' that a new jail is to be built on the site of the mothballed wellingborough prison .
it will be formally announced later today when justice secretary liz truss unveils a white paper .
mr bone had campaigned for the prison to reopen almost as soon as it closed in december 2012 .
sam gyimah , the prisons minister , described the mp as a `` relentless campaigner '' who `` does not let you out of his sight '' .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: wellingborough prison to be knocked down and new jail built
text: wellingborough is set to be `` the first of the modern prisons '' the government is building , prisons minister sam gyimah has told the bbc .
he said the category c prison would be `` very important '' and would be larger than the previous jail , which closed in 2012 and will be knocked down .
mr gyimah said that the project would `` definitely '' be in the building phase before 2020 .
although the size of the prison has n't been confirmed , the guardian is reporting that it 'll be a `` supersized '' prison for 1,000-plus inmates .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: breakingnew prison for wellingborough
text: prisons minister sam gyimah has confirmed to the bbc that a new category c prison will be built on the site of the mothballed jail in wellingborough .

documents.title: some big news coming shortly
text: a new prison for wellingborough to be announced this morning !
great news !
well done to all those who have supported my listening campaign .
hard fought campaign .

where are they , di i miss them ?
cool .

documents.title: weather : cold , with sunshine at first , but becoming cloudy later
text: it 's going to be another cold day , although there will be decent sunny spells once any fog clears .
cloud will increase throughout the day , with perhaps some rain by evening and a high of 9c ( 48f ) .
there are more details on the bbc weather website .
author: Elizabeth Rizzini
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: welcome back to live updates
text: good morning ,
we are here to bring you the news , sport and travel you need for northamptonshire until 18:00 .
plus we 'll have the all-important weather forecast shortly .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: goodbye for now
text: that 's it from the local live team in northamptonshire today .
we 'll be back with more news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but any breaking news will still appear here overnight .
some of the stories we 've featured today :
here 's a lovely autumnal scene from weather watcher clarabella in preston capes to finish us off .
have a good evening !
author: Helen Popham
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : cold night , fine weather turning cloudy tomorrow
text: a cold night this evening with a risk of frost .
lows of -1c ( -30f ) .
tomorrow will see a cold , frosty start to the day with any mist and fog clearing .
there will be fine weather to start the day , but turning cloudy later with the risk of showery outbreaks .
highs of 11c ( 52f ) .
for the latest forecast where you live visit bbc weather .
author: Alex Dolan
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: local soprano to hit the high note for four nations
text: northampton soprano emily haig is preparing to hit the high note this weekend , according to the northampton chronicle and echo .
the paper says she will be performing at the ricoh arena on saturday for the rugby league four nations opener .
you can hear live commentary of england v scotland and new zealand v australia on bbc two and bbc radio 5 live sports extra from 17:00 on saturday .

documents.title: mid-week sport round-up
text: northampton town striker marc richards says his fitness is finally getting back to where he wants it to be .
last season 's top scorer returned as the lone frontman on saturday with two goals against bury , but he has endured a difficult few months .
he said : ''i 've been working hard with the physio to resolve the issues i 've got with my achilles
`` having some shockwave therapy seems to have done the trick - possibly something that we should have looked at last season .
i may have been able to play more games last season if i 'd had that done . ''
northampton saints begin their anglo-welsh cup campaign at the weekend with a trip to newcastle .
saints travel north after a difficult start to the premiership that 's left them eighth after seven matches .
lock michael paterson says it 's a chance to get away from the grind of the premiership and see some of the saints ' young prospects .
he said : ''it takes our mind off the premiership for a while .
there 's loads of youngsters alex moon , jordan onojaife in that second row a lot of competition coming through . ''

documents.title: sous chef is finalist for award
text: he started as a kitchen porter , now he 's a nominee for the young chef of the year award .
that 's the story of markus franklin , a sous chef at the plough in shutlanger , who is a finalist in tomorrow night 's northamptonshire food and drinks awards .
the 24 year-old says it 's an `` honour '' to be up for the award .

documents.title: pedestrian struck by lorry on a43 in 'serious condition '
text: a pedestrian has suffered serious injuries after being struck by a lorry on the a43 in silverstone .
it happened at about 20:20 yesterday on the a43 northbound , just past the green man inn .
the 42-year-old male pedestrian received serious head injuries , police say .
witnesses are being sought .
author: Helen Popham
BBC Local Live

documents.title: england 's wood on being called 'distinctly average '
text: england 's wood on being called 'distinctly average '

documents.title: man , 71 , attempts fourth mount everest climb
text: a corby man is travelling to nepal today to climb mount everest for the fourth time .
ramesh nathwani , 71 , will be trekking to the annapurna base camp , which is more than 13,100ft ( 4,000m ) high .
he 'll be raising money for cancer research uk during the 15 day expedition .
mr nathwani , who will be travelling in a small group , said : `` we 've got time to explore , have a rest or go at our own pace . ''

documents.title: prime minister to look at budget for county 's increasing population
text: theresa may says the government will take into account the increasing population in northamptonshire as it reviews how much money the county gets for local schools , hospitals and policing .
her comments came during prime minister 's questions in response to david mackintosh , the conservative mp for northampton south .
the prime minister said : ''we have protected the schools budget in relation to funding per pupil and we 're protecting the police budget .

`` but of course , as we look at the various ways in which we 're funding public services in his constituency and in the county of northampton , we will as we look at those various formulas be looking at that very issue , as what is right in terms of the need of the local area and the numbers there . ''
author: Helen Popham
BBC Local Live

documents.title: autumnal views of the county
text: after a cold and frosty start to the day , the sun is shining in many parts of the county this lunchtime .
here 's a few lovely views of the county sent in by our weather watchers .
do you recognise any of these places ?
left to right : irthlingborough , daventry , pattishall and watford .
send your photographs to bbc weather watchers here .
the sun may turn a little hazy later on and it will feel rather chilly , with temperatures reaching highs of 9c ( 48f ) .
author: Helen Popham
BBC Local Live

documents.title: youngsters affected by shortage of nursery school teachers
text: hundreds of children across northamptonshire could end up starting school without the skills they need due to a shortage of early years teachers , a charity says .
a report by save the children says 330 nurseries in the county are without a qualified teacher .
nationally there 's been a sharp drop in the number of people applying for jobs in the sector .

jamilla hinds-brough , from save the children , says it 's a real problem : `` the presence of an early years teacher means that a child is 10 % more likely to start school with the skills that they need and that can have a dramatic impact on their chances of success in school and into adulthood . ''
a department for education spokesman said the proportion of full-time staff with the equivalent of at least a-levels had grown from 75 % of 87 % in the five years to 2013 .
`` we want to continue to attract quality staff into the early years , including more trained graduates , '' said the spokesman .

`` we are developing a workforce strategy that aims to remove the barriers to attracting , retaining and developing great people , and we will be investing a record £ 6bn in childcare by the end of this parliament . ''

documents.title: in the local papers today
text: elsewhere in the county :
author: Helen Popham
BBC Local Live

documents.title: future of local pharmacies in doubt
text: the future of local pharmacies in northampton looks uncertain , liberal democrat councillors the town have warned .
the government has cut funding to pharmacies by 12 % leading to fears that smaller ones could close .
the issue will be debated in parliament today and next week a motion will be proposed asking northampton borough council 's chief executive to write to the government .
brian markham , liberal democrat councillor for westone , will propose the motion .

''it 's a primary care source for elderly people and everyone relies on them if they are forced down a & e then that 's an extra cost to the heath service and puts pressure on those resources , '' he said .

documents.title: arson drops by nearly 60 % on corby estate
text: incidents of arson on the kingswood estate in corby have fallen by nearly 60 % following a campaign to tackle the issue .
operation revive began in october 2015 , led by the joint arson task force made up of northamptonshire police , northamptonshire fire and rescue service and the corby community safety partnership .
statistics show that between january and the end of september 2015 , there were 24 deliberate fires in kingswood but during the same period in 2016 there were 10 .
task force coordinator shaun johnson said : `` throughout the past 12 months , numerous activities have been carried out in the area , which have been supported by various agencies .

`` these have included rapid response to reports of fly-tipping , the distribution of information packs , and special take action weeks in which members of corby borough council and the arson task force went door to door , consulting with local residents on some of the key issues . ''
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: bust of charles bradlaugh unveiled at parliament
text: a bust of former northampton mp charles bradlaugh has been unveiled at portcullis house , next to the house of commons .
bradlaugh was first elected at mp for northampton in 1880 , but as an atheist was prevented from taking his seat on several occasions because he would n't take the oath of allegiance .
but the voters of northampton kept re-electing him and eventually the law was changed allowing an mp to `` affirm '' .
this evening i attended the unveiling of a bust in parliament of former northampton mp , charles bradlaugh
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: oundle village green row : inquiry due to begin
text: a public inquiry into whether an open space in oundle should be declared a village green opens today .
the town council wants fletton field to be given the status but the county council , which owns the land , has objected .
the legal status of the field will now be decided at the inquiry .
author: Andrew Radd
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: weather : mostly dry and bright , but colder than of late
text: after a frosty start , it will be a mainly dry day with long spells of sunshine .
it 'll feel colder than late , with a top temperature of 10c ( 50f ) .
catch my full forecast here :
author: Kate Kinsella
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: welcome back to live updates from northamptonshire
text: good morning and welcome to another day of regular live updates of news , sport , weather , travel and more .
we 'll have the full weather forecast for you in a moment , and while it looks like it 's not quite such a foggy start today , it 's definitely colder .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: coverage during the day
text: live updates have now finished for northamptonshire .
our main stories today have been :
we 'll be back tomorrow with all the news , weather , sport and travel from 08.00 , but any breaking news will appear on this page .
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: nursery teacher shortage in northamptonshire
text: a new report says there 's a severe shortage of nursery teachers in northamptonshire .
the report from the charity save the children , states that 330 nurseries in the county are without a qualified early years teacher .
nationally , there has been a 63 % drop in the number of people applying for jobs in the sector , with it being reported that graduates are being put off by low salaries .

documents.title: lord heseltine has bronze bust of lenin on his thenford estate
text: northamptonshire-based lord heseltine has a nine-ton bronze bust of russian revolutionary vladimir lenin on his estate at thenford , an interview in the tatler reveals .
elsewhere in the magazine , an article by sophia money-coutts ranks thenford house number one in its list of `` best meets '' .
`` it 's worth coming for the sausage rolls alone , '' the magazine quotes one fan declaring .

documents.title: weather prospects : coldest night of autumn so far
text: skies will clear this evening and overnight , leading to a chilly night with a widespread air frost .
lows of -1 to 4c ( 30-39f ) .
wednesday will start cold and frosty , and stay chilly despite long spells of sunshine .
highs of 10c ( 50f ) .
get a full forecast from bbc weather .
author: Alex Dolan
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: lord heseltine 'misrepresented ' over death of dog
text: northamptonshire peer lord heseltine , who served as deputy prime minister under john major , has said it was a `` terrible misrepresentation '' to say he killed his mother 's pet dog , an alsatian called kim , after it started biting him .
lord heseltine , who lives in thenford , told tatler magazine the animal had a `` mental breakdown '' , so he grabbed it by the `` choker chain - and pulled it tight '' until `` he went limp '' .
the ex-deputy pm clarified to the bbc that kim had not died but reverted to being `` the dog we all knew and loved '' .
he had a `` terrible dilemma '' , but had the dog put down the next day .
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: northampton graduate 's film pays tribute to robocop
text: we 've been following the story of a fan-funded documentary which examines the legacy of one of hollywood 's best-loved action movies - robocop - .
which is being made by a northampton university graduate christopher griffiths .

mr griffiths ( above ) , who lives in the town , said he 's always been a great fan of the film and with his friends gary smart and adam evans , who are from birmingham , they decided to fund the film through kickstarter .

he went to the us for three weeks and secured interviews with most of the cast and crew of the film including the director paul verhoeven ( below ) , who went on to direct basic instinct , starship troopers and total recall .
he said interviewing mr verhoeven was `` one of the most nerve-wracking moments of my life '' .
`` he [ verhoeven ] was brilliant .
we talked about how the iconography of the film incorporates the jesus imagery of death and resurrection in the character of robocop , '' said mr griffiths .
`` it was verhoeven 's first american film and he worked with an american crew and he was a force of nature . ''
mr griffiths also interviewed the actor ray wise who he described as being `` unbelievably charismatic '' .
more information of mr griffith 's films can be found on the cult screenings website .
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: new firm to run three east northamptonshire leisure centres
text: a new firm has won the contract to manage three leisure centres in northamptonshire .
east northamptonshire district council has awarded freedom leisure the contracts to run the nene centre in thrapston ( and the pemberton centre and splash pool in rushden .
for the last 10 years they have been run by aspirations wellbeing .
the council said 10 companies had tendered for the contract and five were shortlisted .
the new firm has promised more activities in rural parts of the district .
efforts will be made to target older people , children , young people and those with disabilities .
the managing director of the not-for-profit trust freedom leisure , ivan horsfall , said its proposals include `` significant investment '' in facilities and services .
author: Martin Borley
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: northampton student interviews director paul verhoeven
text: we 've been following the story of northampton university graduate christopher griffiths who is making a film about the history of the movie robocop .

he 's come back from three weeks of filming in the usa and has sent us some photographs taken during the shoot including one of mr griffiths interviewing the original film 's director paul verhoeven ( see below ) .
it also includes an interview with ray wise ( see below , with mr griffiths ) , who plays henchman leon c nash in robocop .
the actor also played laura palmer 's father in the television series twin peaks .
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: northampton graduate celebrates robocop with new documentary
text: a fan-funded documentary which examines the legacy of one of hollywood 's best-loved action movies is being made by a university of northampton graduate .

christopher griffiths spent three weeks shooting the film about robocop in the usa this summer and interviewed more than 50 cast and crew members from the original movies , including robocop ( 1987 version ) director paul verhoeven .
before going out , he raised £ 34,000 through kickstarter - a funding platform for creative projects .
the original robocop film grossed more than $ 50m in north america alone .

mr griffiths said : `` it has been an incredibly intense , and at times , challenging project unlike anything we have worked on before - taking us from the uk to los angeles , san fransisco , dallas and new york , with very little free time . ''
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: one from the archives : army horse rider training at weedon bec 1936
text: eighty years ago this month this photograph was taken of british soldiers practising jumping the grid without stirrups or reins at the army equitation school at weedon , northamptonshire .
equitation is the art or practice of horse riding or horsemanship .
the school closed at the end of the 1930s .
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: project focusing on 'building infrastructure ' to get superfast broadband to rural areas
text: sarah naylor , from superfast northamptonshire , said from early next year it 'll be speaking to telecoms providers about getting fibre optic cables to the more rural parts of the county .
ms naylor said having quicker broadband can `` boost staff morale '' for businesses , because employees can `` do things quicker '' .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: number of homes and businesses with superfast broadband rises sharply
text: the number of people signing up to superfast broadband in northamptonshire has increased four-fold over the last two years , following the launch of a new project .
superfast northamptonshire was launched by the county council , with the aim of delivering fibre broadband to the whole county by the end of 2017 .
figures from bt reveal 40 % of homes and businesses in the county have signed up to superfast broadband , compared with 10 % back in 2014 .
the village of orlingbury , near wellingborough , has seen the biggest take up , with 70 % of households and businesses now signed up .
author: Andrew Radd
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: man attacked by gang of 10 men at northampton bus station entrance
text: a gang of up to 10 men attacked and robbed a man by the entrance to northampton 's bus station .

the victim saw another man being kicked on the floor and when he tried to intervene , he was set upon by the gang , who punched and kicked him to the floor , before making off with a quantity of cash .
all the gang members were described as male and black in the incident last thursday , between 18:40 and 19:20 .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: mp for northampton north says constituencies should be same size
text: northampton north mp michael ellis disagrees with his conservative colleague peter bone , saying a change to the parliamentary constituency boundaries is needed .
mr ellis said there should be `` within reason '' close to the same amount of people in each constituency .

labour says the proposals are `` undemocratic '' , but mr ellis says it is n't right that in london there are constituencies with 40,000 people in and then elsewhere in the country a constituency can represent 90,000 people .
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton politics reporter

documents.title: peter bone says brexit means mp numbers should not be cut
text: the mp for wellingborough says now is not the time to be cutting the number of members of the house of commons .
today is the second day of hearings in northampton on plans to re-draw the boundaries of every northamptonshire constituency .
the government is aiming to even out the population in each seat and cut the number of mps from 650 to 600 .
conservative mp peter bone says the situation has now changed .
we 're going to leave the eu and lose 70-80 meps , so all that work is going to come to mps , so we need the same number . ''
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton politics reporter

documents.title: pirate ship swings for the final time
text: pirate ship swings for the final time

documents.title: report says daventry district council needs to help building owners find tenants
text: the report into empty commercial properties was compiled following concern among politicians about the effect of online retailing on daventry businesses .
many of the 275 vacant units are small and some were individual offices in places like the icon building .

the report , which will be discuss by district councillor next week , says the authority is good at making sure commercial space that it owns and rents out is well used , but the same skills could be used to find new occupiers for property owned by other people .
it suggests setting up an online portal for landlords and tenants .
author: Martin Heath
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: daventry district has close to 300 empty commercial properties
text: just over 10 % of all the commercial properties in the daventry district are empty , according to a new report .
the study , which will be discussed by councillors next week , calls for officials to work with landlords and potential occupiers to bring buildings back into use .
author: Martin Heath
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: weather : dense fog at first , but turning brighter and colder later
text: it will be a murky start with widespread and locally dense fog patches .
these will clear during the morning , but it 'll remain cloudy with some drizzle possible and it will feel colder with a high of 11c ( 52f ) .
here 's my full forecast
there are more details on the bbc weather website .
author: Kate Kinsella
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: welcome back to live updates for northamptonshire
text: good morning .
another foggy start across the county and it 's getting colder , but then it is now november
we 'll have the full weather forecast for you in a moment , plus all the news , weather , sport and travel for the county .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: that 's all from us today
text: live updates have now finished for northamptonshire .
we 'll be back tomorrow with all the news , weather , sport and travel from 08.00 , but any breaking news will appear on this page .
have a good ( foggy ) halloween .

documents.title: watch the final pirate ship ride at wicksteed park
text: this is it - the final ride for 32 competition winners on the wicksteed park pirate ship .
the attraction is now closed after 34 years .
it 's being replaced by a giant swing ride next year .

documents.title: overnight weather : dry with mist and some areas of dense fog
text: tonight will be dry with mist and some dense fog patches across the bbc east region .
winds will become light north-westerly , and it 'll feel chilly , with lows of 7-10c ( 45-50f ) .
mist and fog may be slow to clear tomorrow morning , and it 'll be largely cloudy with some outbreaks of light rain and drizzle .
brighter conditions could reach the north of the region towards the end of the day , and it 'll be noticeably cooler , with highs of around 13c ( 55f ) .
weather has the full forecast , wherever you are .
author: Julie Reinger
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: lawes to be assessed by england before autumn internationals
text: northampton saints ' lock courtney lawes will have his knee injury assessed by england medical staff to decide on his fitness , ahead of the autumn internationals that begin on 12 november .
lawes is a doubt for the autumn internationals after being ruled out of northampton 's 23-20 win over gloucester on friday .
the 27-year-old had a swollen knee after training in midweek and will have a scan this week .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: pirate ship replacement 'boring ' and 'pathetic '
text: it seems not everyone is happy with the replacement for the pirate ship at wicksteed park in kettering .
on its facebook page , people have described the wave swing as `` boring '' , `` disappointing '' , `` pathetic '' and `` too similar '' to the other rides in the park .
however , others have said it `` looks really good '' and that children will `` love it '' .
alisdair mcnee , the park 's managing director , said the new ride was `` very modern and very safe '' , and a `` favourite at parks around the world '' .
he also said the height restriction was slightly lower , allowing more children access to the ride , which is due to open in spring 2017 .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: mps say plans to change boundaries should be altered
text: two of northamptonshire 's mps have said proposals to change the boundaries of parliamentary constituencies should be altered .
the boundary commission is holding two days of hearings in northampton about plans that would see all of the county 's boundaries change .
the government wants the number of mps to be reduced .
wellingborough 's peter bone and corby 's tom pursglove said the plans could be altered so fewer people had to be moved to a new constituency .
but northampton north mp michael ellis said the proposals for his constituency were `` sensible and logical '' .
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton politics reporter

documents.title: 'retirement hobby ' gets cider maker award nomination
text: marston trussell .
it 's a village which , if you live in the southern half of northamptonshire , you may never have heard of .
but nestled on the slopes of the welland valley , on the border with leicestershire , it is a beautiful part of the world .
a drink maker there is toasting success , after his richard the third cider was made a finalist at the northamptonshire food and drink awards , due to be dished out on thursday .
david bates has been at the helm of welland valley vineyard for 25 years , and on a bright autumn morning i went to meet him
author: Tom Percival
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: in wicksteed pirate ship 's final ride
text: after 34 years at the park , today marks the end of the pirate ship at wicksteed park .
the last ride took place this morning .
alisdair mcnee , the park 's managing director , said the ride had been a `` firm favourite '' but it had reached the end of its `` lifespan '' .
the ride will now be dismantled over the next week and then taken to kosovo , where a family is going to restore it .
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: man dies in house fire in pitsford
text: a man has died following a fire at a house in pitsford .
fire crews from the mounts , moulton and brixworth fire stations were called to the blaze in manor road shortly after 21:00 yesterday .
investigation officers are at the scene today trying to work out how it started .
it 's left the first floor of the two-storey house severely damaged .
the occupant of the house , a 59-year-old man , died at the scene .
his death is not being treated as sus
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: local paper round-up : dog attack , oundle 'village green ' , and diwali festival
text: elsewhere in northamptonshire today :
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: police say they are 'making progress ' over gangs in wellingborough
text: police in northamptonshire previously said they could deal with the issue of gangs in the county `` on their own '' , but they are now working with reformed gang members , community groups , and schools to tackle the issue .

lara alexander-lloyd , community inspector for wellingborough and rushden , said they were `` making progress '' in areas like the hemmingwell estate in wellingborough , where last year a teenager was shot .
she also said they were proactively working with vulnerable people , particularly children and girls , who may get involved in gang crime .
author: Elinor Cross
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: weather : turning brighter this afternoon
text: a few mist or fog patches may linger this afternoon , but it should be dry and mild with bright or sunny periods developing for most , with a high of 16c ( 61f ) .
there are more details on the bbc weather website .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: women 'at risk ' of northamptonshire gang culture grooming
text: reformed gang members are working with police in northamptonshire to help young women at risk of becoming involved with gang culture .
the force has identified five gangs operating in the county and is working with 100 women they believe to be at risk .
up to 20 teenage girls a month face being groomed into a gang within the area , police say .
cherie johnson is now running a charity helping girls out of gangs and is advising the police on gang subculture and the various roles young women can play in organised crime .
there will be more on this story on inside out at 19:30 on bbc one .
author: Elinor Cross
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: halloween : creepy parkrunners dress for special 5km run
text: they 're creepy and they 're kooky , mysterious and spooky , they 're altogether ooky , the northampton parkrun runners
ok , so it may not scan quite as well , but that did n't stop runners enjoying a special northampton halloween parkrun on saturday .
several participants out of the 409 donned all hallows eve garb , but none could keep up with adam searle - dressed more traditionally - who led them home in 16:32 over the 5km distance .

documents.title: mp gets into halloween spirit
text: mp for daventry , chris heaton-harris , will be wearing some appropriate attire in westminster today
well , it is halloween
finally , a use for all that pirate party and waffen ss memorabilia
have fun chris

documents.title: wicksteed 's pirate ship swings for the final time today
text: the famous pirate ship at wicksteed park in kettering closes down later today , with 32 competition winners having the last ride .
the ship has been at the park since 1982 but has become too expensive to maintain .
it 'll be replaced next year by a new ride called a `` wave swing '' .
author: Martin Borley
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: peephole driver pulled over by police in northampton
text: this was one of the most read stories on the bbc news website yesterday
a motorist `` fixed '' his car window with plastic sheeting and tape , leaving just a small peephole to see his mirror .
he was pulled over by police in northampton on saturday while driving the white toyota on wellingborough road .
officers , who seized 30 cars that day as part of a road policing operation , said it was an `` interesting concept '' .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: spooky morning in roade
text: this chilling image was taken by bbc weather watcher 'coots ' in roade this morning
if you want to send us your halloween images , you can email us or tweet us , or sign up to be a bbc weather watcher .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: lewis hamilton wins mexican grand prix to keep title chase alive
text: lewis hamilton kept his title hopes alive with a comfortable victory over brackley-based mercedes team-mate nico rosberg in the mexican grand prix .
stevenage driver hamilton survived a scare at the start , when he ran wide at the first corner after locking a front tyre .
but otherwise he was untroubled en route to his 51st career win .
there are two races left and rosberg can win the title by finishing second to hamilton in the last two races of the season .
hamilton is 19 points adrift with a total of 50 available in brazil and abu dhabi .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: duckett like no other england opener - jonathan agnew
text: northants ' ben duckett played some extraordinary shots in his 56 - his maiden test half-century in his second match .
in the fourth over of the innings he was playing reverse sweeps ; i do not think any england player has ever opened the innings like that before .
the left-hander has a lot of flair , is certainly different and got england off to a fine start after bangladesh had been bowled out for 296 .
he is a very exciting player , but whether he can continue like that at the top of the order remains to be seen .
though only 22 , duckett has clearly a got very strong character because he dropped an absolute sitter in the field , having made 14 , 15 and seven in his first three test innings with the bat .
for a weaker character that might have been a knock-out blow .
author: Jonathan Agnew
BBC cricket correspondent

documents.title: duckett scores maiden test half century , but england lose to bangladesh for first time
text: bangladesh claimed their first test win over england as the tourists lost 10 wickets for 64 runs after tea , on day three of the second test in dhaka .
northants ' opener duckett ( 56 ) scored his first test half-century but was bowled by 19-year-old off-spinner mehedi with the first ball after tea .
it prompted the stunning collapse - the third worst in history by a team who had been 100 without loss .
england were reduced to 164 all out and bangladesh 's 108-run win meant the series finished 1-1 .
england and duckett go on to india , with the first test of five starting next week .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: weather : gradually brightening up
text: early low cloud , mist and fog patches should very gradually clear most areas to reveal a dry day with some sunny intervals and a high of 16c ( 61f ) .
here is my full forecast
there are more details on the bbc weather website .
author: Kate Kinsella
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: welcome back to live updates for northamponshire
text: hello again ,
it 's a foggy start this morning - rather apt for halloween - meaning there is a yellow weather warning in place in the county for much of this morning .
we 'll have the full weather forecast shortly , and a round-up of the weekend 's sport , plus all the news and travel you need between now and 18:00 .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live
